> [gopa](#comment_1_1L8CRVgxUMJeJzg7CfayTgySbWkk7758Qk): hey, where is hackers blog, that i expected?

hi [gopa] if you were looking for hacking tutorials, this is not the site you want to follow. there are too many sites and videos that teach how to use tools made and use by hackers. But, the reality is that you do not become a hacker just because you follow a tutorial. Hacking is a culture, we as hackers are part of a culture, which has its values and goals. This is a blog written by a hacker, about his thoughts, his questions, his activism. You may call it a hacker's diary for discussion, not a blog of tutorials. If you want to be part of the discussion, you are welcome :)

> [jop](#comment_2_1LuTR1QEnMJDUNLYbtsi7nzNfwcJGAyHRU): Muy dificil tarea. Todo depende de lo que consideramos injusto. Lamentablemente no hay consenso en ese punto. Para unos las relaciones entre empresas y politica es injusto, pero para otros no.

muy cierto [jop] la definicion de injusto puede variar de persona a persona, pero hay varias aplicaciones en la realidad que inegablemente son injustas. Por ejemplo, cualquier practica que someta a otro ser humano a esclavitud o o discriminacion que atente contra su integridad personal. Contra esas cosas si podemos luchar, empezando por nuestros circulos cercanos y continuando con acciones practicas en nuestra sociedad.
